thread.title_full: Bayern Munich news: Carlo Ancelotti raised middle finger to Hertha Berlin fans after being spat on | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Bayern Munich news: Carlo Ancelotti raised middle finger to Hertha Berlin fans after being spat on | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 4:07 pm Carlo Ancelotti raised his middle finger to Hertha Berlin fans. (TF-Images/Getty Images) 
Carlo Ancelotti claims he stuck his middle finger up at a Hertha Berlin fan because he was spat on. 
The incident occurred after Bayern Munichâ€™s 1-1 draw on Saturday as the former Chelsea and Real Madrid manager made his way back to his sideâ€™s dressing room. 
As he walked down the steps towards the tunnel, Ancelotti looked up to the Hertha Berlin supporters before raising his middle finger. 
â€˜Yes, I made this gesture as I was spat at earlier,â€™ the Italian told ARD Sportschau. Carlo Ancelotti with theðŸ–•to a Hertha Berlin fan who spat at him after the game pic.twitter.com/uvgQu4hP2i 
â€” Bayern & Germany (@iMiaSanMia) February 19, 2017 
Bayern sealed a 5-1 victory over Arsenal in the Champions League on Wednesday but appeared to be on course for only their second Bundesliga defeat of the season following Vedad Ibisevicâ€™s first-half opener for Hertha Berlin. 
But in the sixth minute of injury time, Robert Lewandowski struck to rescue an equaliser for the German champions. 
Tempers then flared between the two sides as Hertha Berlin goalkeeper Rune Jarstein kicked the ball at Xabi Alonso.
